title: The King stars Timothée Chalamet, 23, and Joel Edgerton, 45, promote film in South Korea
text:
They just starred in The King together.

And on Wednesday, actors Timothée Chalamet, 23, and Joel Edgerton, 45, proved they have formed a close friendship on the set.

Appearing at the 24th Busan International Film Festival, Timothée was seen affectionately putting his arm around the Australian star.

Brothers in Arms! The King stars Timothée Chalamet, 23, (L) and Joel Edgerton, 45, (R) shared a laugh while they promote the film at the 24th Busan International Film Festival on Wednesday

The two men appeared to be close as they laughed together during the encounter, which saw them put on a panel discussion.

Joel appeared very animated at one point, as he spoke to the gathered crowd with plenty of expression.

Timothée and Joel sat alongside the film's director David Michod during a Q&A, with the trip answering questions from journalists.

For the promotional outing, Timothée wore a plain white t-shirt which he paired with stylish white and red striped pants.

Stars: (from left) The King director David Michod, Timothée and Joel appeared relaxed as they promoted their new film at the film festival in South Korea

Meanwhile, Joel opted to wear a black and white striped t-shirt along with a stylish denim jacket and grey fedora.

The King is an adaptation of a number of plays from Shakespeare's Henriad, including Henry IV and Henry V.

The film follows a wayward prince (played by Timothée) who turned his back on the throne, only to be forced to assume his birthright title after his father's death.

Dual role: Joel (pictured) co-wrote the film as well as stars as ageing alcoholic knight, John Falstaff. He looked full of expression as he spoke to the crowd

Meanwhile, Joel co-wrote the film as well as stars as ageing alcoholic knight, John Falstaff.

Earlier this month, Timothée told Variety that the best part of the historical drama was researching for the role.

'This is one of the coolest parts of the job, the reading, the getting into it, the hours spending with the books, the plays,' the French actor said.

Casual cool! Joel (pictured) opted for a black and white stripe t-shirt for the event, with him pairing with a denim jacket and a grey fedora

The King: Timothee (pictured) stars as King Henry V in tense trailer for Netflix's Shakespeare adaptation, which will be released on Netflix on November 1

'This is a searing portrait of a young man having no clue what circumstance he's in with a skill set that is short of the circumstance he finds himself.'

Timothée and Joel have already confirmed they will attend the Australian premiere of the film later this month.

Australian co-star Joel Edgerton and Timothée, 23, will both walk the red carpet at the Randwick Ritz Cinema in Sydney's eastern suburbs.

The King will have a limited theatrical release on October 10. It will be available to stream on Netflix on November 1.
